greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered ways to write n = k + m (0 < k <= m) with pi(k) + pi(m) - 2 prime, where pi(.) is given by A000720.
comment: (ii) Any integer n > 23 can be written as k + m (k > 0 and m > 0) with pi(k) + pi(m) prime. Also, each integer n > 25 can be written as k + m (k > 0 and m > 0) with pi(k) + pi(m) - 1 prime.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3000
example: a(6) = 1 since 6 = 3 + 3 with pi(3) + pi(3) - 2 = 2 + 2 - 2 = 2 prime.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Feb 08 2014
